file_insights.changes_summary: Added SettingsPage route to the application
file_insights.structural_impact: Added new nested route under protected routes wrapper

patterns_discovered.description: New route follows existing pattern of importing page component and registering it within the ProtectedRoute wrapper
Application uses dedicated page components in /pages directory for each route
patterns_discovered.evidence: ContactsPage, AuditLogPage, InspectionsPage, RFIPage, SettingsPage all follow same naming convention

patterns_discovered.description: All application routes are nested within ProtectedRoute component for authentication
patterns_discovered.evidence: New settings route placed within existing Route wrapper structure

gotchas_discovered.description: Import statement references './pages/SettingsPage' which must be created separately for the application to compile
gotchas_discovered.resolution: SettingsPage component file needs to be created in frontend/src/pages/ directory

gotchas_discovered.description: Route is correctly placed within ProtectedRoute wrapper, ensuring authentication requirements are enforced
gotchas_discovered.resolution: Placement verified as correct; no changes needed

approach_outcome.merge_readiness: Code ready for merge once SettingsPage component is implemented

recommendations.description: Implement frontend/src/pages/SettingsPage.tsx to resolve import error and enable route functionality
Consider adding Settings link to navigation menu/header for user discoverability
Verify /settings route renders correctly when authenticated and redirects when unauthenticated
